name: Claim compensation for a criminal injury
description: You might be able to claim compensation if you were the victim of a violent crime.

name: Claim compensation for victims of terrorist attacks abroad
description: You may be able to claim compensation if you’ve been a victim of terrorism abroad since 27 November 2012.

name: Claim compensation if you're a victim of crime abroad
description: You can usually apply for compensation if you’re a UK resident and have been injured because of a violent crime in another country.

name: Get financial support as a victim of crime
description: You can apply for financial help if you have to take time off low-paid work because you’ve been the victim of a violent crime.

name: Adopt a child
description: An overview of what you need to know about adopting a child in the UK

name: Agricultural land and drainage disputes: apply to a tribunal
description: How to solve a dispute with a landlord or tenant about certain farming tenancies, or with a neighbour on ditches or drainage work.

name: Appeal a call up to the reserve forces
description: Appeal to the tribunal. Write a letter called a ‘notice of appeal’ to the Secretary of Tribunals.

name: Appeal a county court, High Court or tribunal decision
description: How to appeal a county court, High Court or tribunal decision to the Court of Appeal.

name: Appeal a decision by the immigration and asylum tribunal
description: How to appeal. You must be able to make a case for why the decision was legally wrong.

name: Appeal a housing benefit decision
description: Housing Benefit is handled by your local council - contact the council to question its decision and follow its appeals procedure.

name: Appeal a sentence or conviction
description: Appeal a magistrates' court verdict against your conviction, sentence or both if you pleaded not guilty at your trial. If you pleaded guilty, you can only appeal against your sentence.

name: Appeal a special educational needs statement decision
description: Appeal to the tribunal. You must have parental responsibility for the child, or be their foster parent or carer. They must be at least school age and under 20 years old.

name: Appeal against a ban on your organisation
description: How to appeal to the Proscribed Organisations Appeal Commission if you disagree with a Home Office decision to ban an organisation.

name: Appeal against a Charity Commission decision about your charity
description: How to appeal to an independent tribunal if you disagree with a Charity Commission decision about your organisation.

name: Appeal against a penalty charge notice
description: Getting more time to challenge a court order. You can ask for more time to challenge a court order (‘order of recovery’)

name: Appeal against a visa or immigration decision
description: How to appeal to the First-tier Tribunal (Immigration and Asylum Chamber) at the Home Office

name: Appeal against an environmental fine or notice
description: How to appeal to a tribunal against fine, notice or other sanction issued by the Environment Agency, Natural England or another regulator.

name: Appeal against the Information Commissioner
description: How to appeal to a Tribunal against the Information Commissioner's Office or ask the Tribunal to direct a response if you have not heard from the Information Commissioner’s Office.

name: Appeal an asylum support decision
description: Overview of how to appeal to the First-tier Tribunal (Asylum Support)

name: Appeal an education, health and care plan decision
description: Appeal as a parent if you have parental responsibility for the child, or are their foster parent or carer. Your child must be under the school leaving age.

name: Appeal to the Care Standards Tribunal
description: How to appeal if you're excluded, removed or suspended from a register to work with or care for children or vulnerable adults.

name: Appeal to the Employment Appeal Tribunal
description: You can appeal to the Employment Appeal Tribunal (EAT) if you think a legal mistake was made in an employment tribunal case.

name: Appeal to the Primary Health Lists Tribunal
description: How to appeal if you are left off a list of NHS providers, such as the medical, dental or ophthalmic performers lists, or pharmaceutical list.

name: Appeal to the Social Security and Child Support Tribunal
description: Appeal a decision about your entitlement to benefits, eg Personal Independence Payment (PIP), Employment and Support Allowance (ESA) and Universal Credit.

name: Appeal to the tax tribunal
description: How to appeal against a tax decision, how to apply to close an enquiry and how to return to a saved appeal or application.

name: Appeal to the tax tribunal: apply to close an enquiry
description: How to ask the judge to end a tax enquiry with a closure, counteraction or no-counteraction notice.

name: Appeal to the upper tribunal (tax and chancery)
description: How you may be able to appeal to the Upper Tribunal (Tax and Chancery Chamber) if you think there was a legal mistake made against you by certain lower tribunals and organisations.

name: Apply for a gender recognition certificate
description: Overview of how you can apply to the Gender Recognition Panel for a Gender Recognition Certificate if you want your acquired gender to be legally recognised in the UK.

name: Apply for a grant of representation (wills, probate and inheritance)
description: Applying for probate. If you’re an executor you can apply for probate yourself or use a solicitor or another person licensed to provide probate services.

name: Apply for a one-off decision from the Court of Protection
description: Apply if you are concerned about the personal welfare or property and financial affairs of someone who’s lost mental capacity

name: Apply for a transcript of a court or tribunal hearing
description: You can apply for a transcript of a court or tribunal hearing if the hearing was recorded.

name: Apply for a cremation
description: Forms for applying for a cremation, including certificates and authorisation forms for doctors, funeral directors and crematorium managers.

name: Apply for an exhumation licence
description: You need to apply for a licence to remove human remains from the ground.

name: Apply for a deprivation of liberty order
description: How to apply to the Court of Protection to challenge an order restricting someone's freedom or get a deprivation of liberty authorised.

name: Apply for bankruptcy
description: Apply for bankruptcy in England and Wales.

name: Apply or appeal to the Upper Tribunal (Lands Chamber)
description: Appeal to the Upper Tribunal (Lands Chamber) if you think there was a legal problem with a decision

name: Apply to bankrupt someone who owes you money
description: Present a bankruptcy petition to a court if you want to bankrupt someone because they owe you money.

name: Apply to be a litigation friend
description: Apply to be someone’s litigation friend by either providing a copy of the court order that appointed you or filling in a certificate of suitability if you’re not the person’s deputy

name: Apply to the land registration tribunal
description: You need to apply to the Land Registration division of the Property Chamber (First-tier Tribunal) if you want to correct or cancel certain documents relating to registered land.

name: Apply to the Mental Health Tribunal
description: Download and fill in an application to the First-tier Tribunal (Mental Health). Post or email the notice of appeal form to HM Courts and Tribunals Service.

name: Approved driving instructors: appeal a registration decision
description: How to appeal to an independent tribunal if you disagree with a decision about your trainee licence or registration as a driving instructor.

name: Arranging child maintenance yourself
description: How to arrange child maintenance yourself if both parents agree. A ‘family-based arrangement’ is a private way to sort out child maintenance.

name: Ask for a Crown Court sentence to be reviewed
description: You can ask for someone’s Crown Court sentence to be reviewed if you think it’s too low.

name: Become a magistrate
description: Magistrates are volunteers who hear cases in courts in their community. They can hear cases in the criminal court, the family court, or both.

name: Bring a case to the administrative court
description: How to use the Administrative Court, part of the High Court which can hear cases about judicial reviews, statutory appeals and extradition.

name: Bring a case to the court (Queen's Bench Division)
description: How to start a case in the Queen’s Bench, part of the High Court which deals with claims such as personal injury, libel and contract law.

name: Calculate your child maintenance
description: Use this calculator to estimate your child maintenance. It can help you to agree an amount with the other parent and get an idea of the amount the government would work out for you.

name: Case tracker for civil appeals
description: Search for information on applications or appeals in the Court of Appeal, Civil Division

name: Challenge a benefit decision
description: You can ask for mandatory reconsideration by contacting the benefits office that gave you the decision. You can contact them by phone, letter or by filling in and returning a form.

name: Challenge a gangmasters licence decision
description: How to appeal to a tribunal if you disagree with a Gangmasters and Labour Abuse Authority decision on a full or provisional gangmaster's licence.

name: Change your name by deed poll
description: You do not have to follow a legal process to start using a new name. But you might need a ‘deed poll’ to apply for or to change official documents like your passport or driving licence.

name: Civil claims rates calculator
description: Includes rates calculator and guidance for claims in civil matters.

name: Claim back legal aid costs for confiscation proceedings
description: Forms for solicitors and advocates to claim back legal aid costs for confiscation proceedings.

name: Claim compensation when a road affects your property's value
description: The value of your property must have gone down by more than £50 as the result of specific types of pollution or disturbance from the use of a new or altered road.

name: Complain about a judge, magistrate, tribunal member or coroner
description: You can complain if you’re unhappy with a judge, magistrate, tribunal member or coroner’s behaviour, language or conduct.

name: Complain about a school or childminder
description: Follow the school’s complaints process if a school has discriminated against someone because of their disability.

name: Court and tribunal fees
description: If you’re on a low income, or if you’re on certain benefits and do not have much in savings, you might be able to get money off your court or tribunal fee.

name: Court lists (daily court)
description: Daily court hearing lists for the Royal Courts of Justice and the Rolls Building

name: Employment tribunals: Response to Claim
description: Complete and submit an ET3 response form when someone makes an employment tribunal claim against you.

name: Evict a tenant using accelerated possession
description: You must follow strict procedures if you want your tenants to leave your property. You may be guilty of harassing or illegally evicting your tenants if you don't.

name: Find a will or probate document (England and Wales)
description: Find a will or ‘grant of representation’ for people who died in or after 1858.

name: Find and claim money in a court account
description: You can find and claim money you’re entitled to from a civil court in England and Wales if it hasn’t been claimed.

name: Find court and tribunal forms and leaflets
description: Search court and tribunal forms on GOV.UK

name: Find the right court or tribunal
description: Find the right court or tribunal

name: Form MPs Expenses: Notice of Appeal
description: This form should be used by current Members of Parliament or former Members of Parliament to make or notify an expenses appeal to the First-tier Tribunal (Tax Chamber).

name: Get a divorce
description: You can get a divorce in England or Wales if you’ve been married at least a year and your relationship has permanently broken down.

name: Get a legal separation
description: To get a legal separation, you need to fill in a separation petition and send it to the court. A legal separation allows you to live apart, without divorcing or ending a civil partnership.

name: Get help paying court and tribunal fees (help with fees)
description: You might be able to get money off your court or tribunal fees if you have little or no savings, are on certain benefits or have a low income.

name: Get help with child arrangements
description: Use this guide if you need to make or change child arrangements (also known as contact, access or custody) with the other parent.

name: Immigration and asylum daily court lists
description: The daily court lists will be updated for the following day between midday and 5pm.

name: Joint property ownership
description: You must apply to the Court of Protection if all of the following apply: you’re one of 2 or more owners of property or land, one of the owners has lost ‘mental capacity’ and you want to sell the property or land.

name: Make a claim to an employment tribunal
description: You usually have to make your claim within 3 months of your employment ending or the problem happening and you have to contact Acas to use their free Early Conciliation service.

name: Jury service
description: You must do jury service when you’re sent a jury summons form, unless you’re allowed to delay it.

name: Make a money claim online
description: You can make a money claim if you think a person or organisation owes you money and will not pay you back. You’ll have to pay a fee.

name: Make a plea for a traffic offence
description: Use this service to plead guilty or not guilty to a traffic offence if you are the person charged with the offence or an official representative of the company charged with the offence.

name: Make a statutory will on behalf of someone else
description: Apply to the Court of Protection if you want to make (or change) a will on behalf of someone who cannot do it themselves.

name: Make a victim representation to the Mental Health Tribunal
description: If you’re the victim of a serious crime by a restricted patient detained because of mental illness, you can ask for certain conditions on their release (‘discharge’).

name: Make an urgent or emergency application to the Court of Protection
description: You can apply to the Court of Protection to get an urgent or emergency court order in certain circumstances, for example when someone’s life or welfare is at risk.

name: Make and serve a statutory demand, or challenge one
description: You can make a statutory demand to ask for payment of a debt from an individual or company.

name: Make debt deductions to employee's pay
description: Deductions are made from an employee’s wages if there is a court order. Eg to pay off unpaid maintenance payments or a county court judgment.

name: Make decisions for someone who lacks capacity
description: You can apply to become someone’s deputy if they ‘lack mental capacity’. This means they cannot make a decision for themselves at the time it needs to be made.

name: Making child arrangements if you divorce or separate
description: You can choose how to make arrangements for looking after your children if you separate from your partner.

name: Ministry of Justice subject access request form
description: Make a freedom of information (FOI) request

name: Miscarriage of justice: claim compensation
description: You can apply for compensation if your conviction has been overturned (or quashed) by the courts.

name: Object to the registration of a power of attorney
description: You can apply to the Court of Protection to get an urgent or emergency court order in certain circumstances, eg when someone’s life or welfare is at risk.

name: Pay a court fine online
description: You can pay a court fine or charge online or by phone.

name: Pay or appeal immigration and asylum appeal fees
description: Submit an appeal, make a payment or continue submitting an appeal in relation to immigration and asylum fees.

name: Pay money into the court funds office
description: You must pay into the Court Funds Office if you’ve been ordered to make a payment or you have to refund an overpayment.

name: Planning Court
description: Carries out judicial reviews of decisions made by planning authorities and hears other challenges to planning decisions.

name: Possession Claim Online: recover property
description: You can take court action to repossess a property if you’re owed money for rent or a mortgage, and the tenant or mortgage holder won’t pay.

name: Procedure rules
description: Civil, Criminal and Family procedure rules and their related practice directions.

name: Refer a financial service or energy market decision to a tribunal
description: How to refer a decision by a financial services regulator or Ofgem to the Upper Tribunal (Tax and Chancery Chamber).

name: Register an enduring power of attorney
description: You must register the enduring power of attorney (EPA) as soon as the donor starts to lose mental capacity.

name: Register as a childminder or childcare provider (England)
description: If you want to be paid to look after children under 8, you might need to register with Ofsted or a childminder agency.

name: Represent yourself in court
description: You have the right to speak for yourself in court without a solicitor or other legal professional.

name: Request leave for restricted patients
description: Complete this form to apply for S17 leave for a restricted patient being treated for mental health issues at your hospital.

name: Request your personal data from the MOJ
description: Our personal information charter and how to request a copy of your personal data.

name: Road Traffic Act personal injury forms
description: Road Traffic Act (RTA) personal injury forms including the form to contest an RTA claim.

name: Search the certificated bailliffs register
description: This register holds details of all enforcement agents (previously called bailiffs) who hold a certificate, granted by a judge at the county court.

name: Solve a residential property dispute
description: You can apply to the First-Tier Tribunal (Property Chamber - Residential Property) if you’re a landlord, tenant, freeholder, leaseholder, park home occupier or site owner.

name: Take a business dispute to the Commercial Circuit Court
description: How to take a dispute with another company to the Commercial Circuit Court if you run a small or medium sized business.

name: Take a case to the Chancery Division
description: How to start a case in the Chancery Division of the High Court, which deals with business, property, land, competition and probate disputes.

name: Take a case to the Technology and Construction Court
description: How to take someone to court over a construction, building, engineering or another technically complex dispute.

name: Take a maritime or shipping dispute to the Admiralty Court
description: How to take someone to the court to get compensation or payment for a collision at sea, a ship mortgage or another shipping dispute.

name: Use or cancel an enduring power of attorney
description: An enduring power of attorney (EPA) is a document that appoints someone (‘an attorney’) to help manage your property, money and financial affairs.

name: Consumer Credit Appeals Decisions
description: Find decisions on cases heard by the Consumer Credit Appeals tribunal

name: Primary Health Lists Decisions
description: Find decisions on cases heard by the Primary Health List tribunal

name: Victims information service
description: Get support in your local area

name: War Pensions and Armed Forces compensation tribunal
description: You can appeal to the First-tier Tribunal (War Pensions and Armed Forces Compensation Chamber) if you disagree with a decision about your war pension or compensation.

name: Working with restricted patients
description: Forms and guidance for professionals working with restricted patients (mentally disordered offenders).

name: Decisions on appeals against employment tribunals (post Dec '15)
description: Find decisions on appeals against employment tribunals heard by the Employment Appeal Tribunal.

name: Decisions on Employment Tribunal cases (post Feb '17)
description: Find decisions on Employment Tribunal cases in England, Wales and Scotland from February 2017 onwards.

name: Tax & Chancery Decisions (Upper Tier)
description: Find decisions on Tax and Chancery Cases heard by the Upper Tier Tribunal

name: Tax Tribunal decisions (First Tier)
description: Find decisions on cases heard by the first tier Tax Tribunal

name: Claims Management Services Decisions
description: Find decisions on cases heard by the Claims Management Tribunal

name: Charity Tribunal Decisions
description: Find decisions on cases heard by the Charity Tribunal

name: Estate Agent Tribunal Decisions
description: Find decisions on cases heard by the Estate Agent Tribunal

name: Special Immigration and Appeals Commission Decisions
description: Find decisions on cases heard by the Special Immigation and Appeals tribunal

name: Administrative Appeals Chamber Reports
description: Find decisions on cases heard by the Administrative Appeals Chamber (before January 2016)

name: Administrative Appeals Decisions
description: Find decisions on cases heard by the Administrative Appeals tribunal

name: Social Security and Child Support venue pages
description: Find details of where the Social Security and Child Support Tribunal sits

name: Immigration and Asylum Daily Court List (UTIAC)
description: Daily court hearing lists for Immigration and Asylum cases  heard by the Upper Tribunal

name: Immigration and Asylum Daily Court List
description: Daily court hearing lists for Immigration and Asylum cases

name: Land Registration Division Tribunal (First Tier)
description: Find decisions on cases heard by the Land Registration Division of the First Tier tribunal

name: Immigration Services Tribunal
description: Find decisions on cases heard by the Immigration Services tribunal

name: Information Tribunal
description: Find decisions on cases heard by the Information Rights tribunal

name: Lands Chamber Tribunal
description: Find decisions on cases heard by the Lands Chamber

name: Transport Tribunal
description: Find decisions on cases heard by the Transport Appeals Tribunal

name: Administrative Appeals Tribunal
description: Find decisions on cases heard by the Administrative Appeals Tribunal

name: Asylum Support Tribunal
description: Find decisions on cases heard by the Asylum Support Tribunal

name: Employment Appeals Tribunal
description: Find decisions on cases heard by the Asylum Support Tribunal before March 2017

name: General Regulatory Chamber - Local Government Standards (First Tier)
description: Find decisions on First Tier cases heard by the General Regulatory Chamber - Local Government Standards

name: Care Standards Tribunal
description: Find decisions on cases heard by the Care Standards Tribunal

name: Criminal injuries compensation tribunal
description: Find decisions on cases heard by the Criminal Injuries Compensation Tribunal

name: Finance and Tax Tribunal (First tier)
description: Find decisions on First Tier cases heard by the Finance and Tax Tribunal

name: Email a prisoner
description: Email a Prisoner offers an efficient, secure alternative method of communication for prisoners, their families, friends, legal professionals and related organisations

name: Find a prisoner
description: Use the Prisoner Location Service to find people in prison when you do not know which prison they are in.

name: Get help with the cost of prison visits
description: If you visit a family member, partner or someone who doesn’t get other visitors you might be able to get help paying for travel to the prison, somewhere to stay overnight and meals

name: Nominate a Community Payback project
description: Nominate a Community Payback project to suggest what unpaid work is carried out by offenders in your local area

name: Prisons data
description: Information on how the government is reforming the way prisons work in order to improve how they protect the public, keep staff and prisoners safe, and help offenders turn away from crime

name: Prison and probation jobs website
description: Prison and probation jobs are tough and rewarding. Play your part in helping to turn lives around. Receive great training, benefits and career opportunities in return.

name: Prison Finder
description: Find a prison in England and Wales

name: Prison Service Instructions
description: There are a number of rules, regulations and guidelines by which prisons are run. These are outlined in Prison Service Instructions (PSIs).

name: Prison Service Orders
description: There are a number of rules, regulations and guidelines by which prisons are run. These are outlined in Prison Service Instructions (PSIs) and Prison Service Orders (PSOs). PSOs were issued until 31 July 2009.

name: Send money to someone in prison
description: You can use this service to make a payment by debit card. You can also find out how to make a UK bank transfer to a prisoner by online banking, mobile banking app, telephone banking

name: Visit someone in prison
description: Use this service to book a social visit to a prisoner in England or Wales

name: Volunteer to check standards in prison
description: Independent Monitoring Boards check the day-to-day standards of prisons - each prison has one associated with it. You don’t need specific qualifications and you get trained.

name: Browse Justice
description: Crime, justice and the law information.

name: Justice Jobs
description: Search for jobs and apply for them.

name: Open Justice
description: Making sense of justice system.

name: Secure email
description: Access and information about secure email.

name: You be the Judge
description: Roleplay: you hear the case, you decide the sentence.

name: Contact the Ministry of Justice
description: Use this service to send a message to the Ministry of Justice

name: Amend a legal certificate (via CCMS)
description: A gateway to signing onto Legal Aid Agency services

name: Apply for civil legal aid (via CCMS)
description: Legal Aid Agency form finder

name: Apply for civil legal aid (incl. Welsh)
description: A gateway to signing onto Legal Aid Agency services

name: Apply for exceptional case funding (provider application)
description: A gateway to signing onto Legal Aid Agency services

name: Apply for exceptional case funding (citizen application)
description: Exceptional case funding (ECF) form, provider information pack (inquests and non-inquests) and funding guidance.

name: Apply for legal aid in controlled work cases
description: Forms to apply for legal aid in controlled work cases, including immigration and mental health, family mediation and appeals.

name: Apply for criminal legal aid
description: A gateway to signing onto Legal Aid Agency services

name: Apply for criminal legal aid and exceptional case funding if you do no have a crime contract
description: Clients applying for criminal legal aid application: main application form (CRM14), eForm CRM14, financial statement (CRM15) client details (CRM1).

name: Appeal for legal aid based on interest of justice following a refusal
description: Application to appeal grant of legal aid refused on interests of justice criteria (PDF)

name: Add and remove solicitors from a rota
description: For newly qualified duty solicitors or for duty solicitors that will have joined your firm by the date the rota starts.

name: Check if you can get legal aid
description: Help to find out whether you can get legal aid to help pay for legal advice. You’ll be told where you can get legal advice.

name: Eligibility calculator
description: Civil Legal Aid eligibility calculator

name: Find a legal aid advisor
description: Find a legal adviser or solicitor in your area. You can search by organisation name, town or area of law (eg employment, immigration or family law).

name: Report fraud to the Legal Aid Agency
description: If you suspect an instance of fraud, internally or externally, you can use this form to confidentially report it.

name: Claim for Crown Court Defence cases
description: A service for solicitors and barristers to claim fees for Crown court defence cases.

name: Report crime lower work to the Legal Aid Agency
description: A gateway to signing onto Legal Aid Agency services

name: Report crime lower work to the Legal Aid Agency
description: Report crime lower work to the Legal Aid Agency

name: Claim for escape fee cases
description: How to apply to the Criminal Cases Unit for a Very High Cost Case (VHCC) contract

name: Claim for high cost crime cases
description: How to apply to the Criminal Cases Unit for a Very High Cost Case (VHCC) contract

name: Claim for prior authority to incur disbursements
description: The Criminal Cases Unit is responsible for assessing a range of claims paid out of the Legal Aid Fund

name: Claim for cases that were through a virtual court
description: Spreadsheet for solicitor claims for virtual court hearings

name: Claim for defendant cost orders
description: Allows providers to claim for defence cost under a defendant cost order

name: Claim for private prosecution cases
description: Form for acquitted defendants, private prosecutors and court appointees to apply for the costs of magistrates' and crown court cases

name: Make a court appointee claim
description: Form for claiming criminal court costs from central funds as a private prosecutor or court appointee

name: Claim for extradition cases
description: The Criminal Cases Unit is responsible for assessing a range of claims paid out of Central Funds

name: Claim for Proceeds of Crime Act (POCA) bills
description: Forms for solicitors and advocates to claim back legal aid costs for confiscation proceedings

name: Housing Posession Court Duty Solicitor
description: Duty solicitors: forms, guidance and invitations to tender for HPCDS

name: Claim through CCMS (incl. high cost cases)
description: A gateway to signing onto Legal Aid Agency services

name: Claim for controlled work
description: Claiming for controlled work enables legal aid providers to claim for civil and criminal advice and assistance

name: Claim for escape fees cases
description: A service for providers to claim for escape fee cases

name: Legacy cases billing (pre CCMS)
description: A gateway to signing onto Legal Aid Agency services

name: Complete the deputy report
description: Use this online service to fill in your deputy report and send it to the Office of the Public Guardian (OPG)

name: Create, register, object to or disclaim a lasting power of attorney or enduring power of attorney
description: Create, register, object to or disclaim a lasting power of attorney or enduring power of attorney.

name: Find out if someone has an attorney or deputy acting for them
description: Apply to search the Office of the Public Guardian (OPG) registers to see if someone has another person acting on their behalf.

name: Make a lasting power of attorney
description: This online service will help you to create a lasting power of attorney (LPA) for England and Wales.

name: Make decisions on behalf of someone
description: Someone can choose you to make and carry out certain decisions on their behalf.

name: Report a concern about an attorney or deputy
description: Contact the Office of the Public Guardian if you have concerns about an attorney or a deputy, eg the misuse of money or decisions that aren’t in the best interests of the person they’re responsible for.

name: Claim a power of attorney refund
description: You can get part of your application fee back if you applied to register a power of attorney from 1 April 2013 to 31 March 2017.

name: Appoint the Public Trustee as executor of your estate
description: You can appoint the Public Trustee as the executor of your estate to deal with your property and money after you die.

name: Child maintenance if one parent lives abroad
description: You can ask the court for help if your ex-partner does not pay any child maintenance they owe you. This is known as taking ‘enforcement action’.

name: File a notice to quit when your tenant dies
description: The tenancy is transferred temporarily to the Public Trustee if a tenant dies without a will or with a will but without an executor.

name: Find help to get your child back from abroad or arrange contact
description: Find out who to contact if you want to get your child returned from abroad, arrange contact with your child who is in another country, get a court order for contact enforced.

name: Find out if a tenancy has been ended after a tenant's death
description: Check if a tenancy has been ended after a tenant’s death to make sure you can legally rent the property again or sell it.

name: Academy for Social Justice Commissioning
description: The Academy for Social Justice Commissioning identifies, supports and promotes excellence in social justice commissioning.

name: Children and Family Court Advisory and Support Service
description: Putting children and young people first in the family courts.

name: Civil Justice Council
description: The primary role of the Civil Justice Council (CJC) is to advise the Lord Chancellor, the Judiciary and the Civil Procedure Rule Committee on civil matters.

name: Civil Procedure Rule Committee
description: The Civil Procedure Rule Committee was set up under the Civil Procedure Act 1997 to make rules of court for the Civil Division of the Court of Appeal, the High Court and the County Court.

name: Courts and tribunals judiciary
description: Information and news about the courts and tribunals judiciary.

name: Criminal Cases Review Commission
description: An independent public body set up to investigate possible miscarriages of justice in England, Wales and Northern Ireland.

name: Criminal Procedure Rule Committee
description: The Criminal Procedure Rules govern the way criminal cases are managed, and set out the processes of the criminal courts.

name: Family Justice Council
description: The primary role of the Family Justice Council is to promote an inter-disciplinary approach to family justice and to monitor the system.

name: Family Procedure Rule Committee
description: The Family Procedure Rule Committee (FPRC) makes rules of court that govern the practice and procedure followed in family proceedings in the High Court and family court.

name: HM Inspectorate of Prisons
description: Her Majesty’s Inspectorate of Prisons for England and Wales (HMI Prisons) is an independent inspectorate which reports on conditions for and treatment of those in prison, young offender institutions and immigration detention facilities.

name: HM Inspectorate of Probation
description: An independent source of fair comment for ministers and the public on the effectiveness of the work of probation and youth offending services.

name: Independent Advisory Panel on Deaths in Custody (IAP)
description: The IAP plays an important role in helping to shape government policy through the provision of independent advice and expertise to the Ministerial Board on Deaths in Custody.

name: Independent Monitoring Board
description: Monitoring fairness and respect for people in custody.

name: Insolvency Rules Committee
description: The Insolvency Rules Committee considers amendments to the rules arising out of a review of secondary insolvency legislation, giving their recommendations to the Lord Chancellor.

name: Judicial Appointments and Conduct Ombudsman
description: Investigating the handling of complaints about the judicial appointments process, and the handling of complaints involving judicial discipline or conduct.

name: Judicial appointments: complain to the ombudsman
description: How to take your case to the ombudsman if you are not happy with the handling of your application for a judicial appointment.

name: Judicial Conduct Investigations Office
description: An independent office which supports the Lord Chancellor and Lord Chief Justice in considering complaints about the personal conduct of judicial office holders.

name: Judicial conduct: complain to the ombudsman
description: How to apply to the ombudsman if you made a complaint about a judge or another judicial officer, and think it wasn't dealt with properly.

name: Judicial Office
description: The Judicial Office supports the judiciary and the non-devolved tribunals across the UK, by providing training, legal and policy advice, human resources, communications and administrative support.

name: Law Commission
description: The Law Commission is the statutory independent body created by the Law Commissions Act 1965 to keep the law of England and Wales under review and to recommend reform where it is needed.

name: Lay Observers website
description: Lay Observers play an important role in the justice system by monitoring the welfare and access to justice of people being brought to court and held in court custody.

name: Legal Ombudsman
description: The Legal Ombudsman for England and Wales is set up to look at complaints about legal service providers and claims management companies in a fair and independent way.

name: Legal Ombudsman complaint form
description: Make a complaint to the Legal Ombudsman for England and Wales.

name: National Preventive Mechanism
description: The UK National Preventive Mechanism was established in 2009 to strengthen the protection of people in detention through independent monitoring.

name: Prison and Probation Ombudsman
description: The Prisons and Probation Ombudsman (PPO) carries out independent investigations into deaths and complaints in custody.

name: Prison Service Pay Review Body
description: Independent advice on pay for governors, operation managers, prison officers and support grades in the England and Wales Prison Service, and equivalent posts in Northern Ireland.

name: Public Defender Service
description: The Public Defender Service was established in 2001 and provides high quality defence representation in all types of criminal cases.

name: Tribunal Procedure Committee
description: The Tribunal Procedure Committee makes rules governing the practice and procedure in the First-tier Tribunal and the Upper Tribunal.

name: Unclaimed Balances Index (Office of Accountant General)
description: Search the Unclaimed Balances Index

name: Victims Commissioner website
description: The role of the Victims' Commissioner is to promote the interests of victims and witnesses, encourage good practice in their treatment, and regularly review the Code of Practice.

name: Youth Justice Board website
description: The Youth Justice Board are a non-departmental public body responsible for overseeing the youth justice system in England and Wales.

name: Youth Justice Resource Hub
description: News And Information From RSS Feeds Of Organisations Across The Youth Justice Sector.
